title: Documentation: `spack test operating_system` crashes
body:
When trying to import all of the Python packages for docstring documentation, Sphinx issues the following error message:

```
spack.test.rst:201: WARNING: autodoc: failed to import module u'spack.test.operating_system'; the following exception was raised:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack-0.9.1/opt/spack/linux-centos6-x86_64/gcc-6.1.0/python-2.7.12-g5ik6qb4hhhjye4gefrnxmbljjvot7wg/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Sphinx-1.4.5-py2.7.egg/sphinx/ext/autodoc.py", line 518, in import_object
    __import__(self.modname)
  File "/blues/gpfs/home/software/spack-0.9.1/lib/spack/spack/test/operating_system.py", line 30, in <module>
    from spack.platforms.cray_xc import CrayXc
ImportError: No module named cray_xc
```

Recently, the cray_xc.py file was renamed to cray.py. The import statement in operating_system.py wasn't updated to reflect this.

This bug was discovered in #1576 by adding documentation testing. It will be fixed in #1576. This issue is being opened to track the problem.
